rComments: His class was interesting, I read material I never would have seen otherwise, he's passionate about what he teaches, and he has great musical taste. On the other hand, he can be a little insensitive; he seems to have a low tolerance for opinions he doesn't agree with. Also, he sometimes used Spanish words in lecture, and I don't know Spanish.

So basically this week marks the first month of being in his class... and I have not learned one thing form his lectures. It feels as though I am taking an independent study course. I learn what I know from my TAs. This class is lame. He shows videos, ends the class, and never refers backs to them. He is a bad teacher. DO NOT RECCOMEND
very tough but also very helpful and understanding. a revolutionary professor!

Ditto to the comments above. If you say the wrong thing you will get laughed at. Teacher is more mediator between students commenting on material than actual instructor. Instructions on syllabus were unclear. Very disappointing.Subject matter could have been great with someone else.

He is a very intelectual professor. He does assaign a lot of reading. Class can be hard, but i feel that it's just because he is very passionate about what he teaches. If you take him serriously, he will do the same. Overall, fair experience. Not great, but not horrible as with other professors. I would take this class.

I didn't like him at ALL, he picks favorites, and when I'd say something in class he'd laugh like I was stupid, there was a lot of readings and a 10pg final paper. His lectures were very confusing, he'd talk about one thing and then not know how to explain it and you have to read to participate. I wouldn't take his class.
